meanings.definition: The relative ability of an atom to attract shared electrons in a chemical bond.
meanings.sent1: In chemistry class, we learned about the electronegativities of different elements.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use electronegativities to predict how atoms will bond with each other.
meanings.sent3: The electronegativities of the elements decided who would be the leader of the molecule group.
meanings.sent4: Her electronegativities were so strong, she could easily pull others towards her.
meanings.sent5: The electronegativities of oxygen and hydrogen determine the nature of water molecules.

meanings.definition: The measure of the tendency of an atom to attract a bonding pair of electrons.
meanings.sent1: Understanding electronegativities helps us comprehend chemical reactions better.
meanings.sent2: Chemists use electronegativities to explain why certain atoms form stable compounds.
meanings.sent3: The electronegativities of the atoms were like magnets, pulling the electrons towards them.
meanings.sent4: His electronegativities were so high, he always ended up with the bonding pair of electrons.
meanings.sent5: The electronegativities of carbon and oxygen play a crucial role in organic chemistry.
